poem:
Title: "Epistle from an Unquiet Age"

In the field of justice, an adult star burns,
Her resolve stands against the tempest of deceit.
Silken restraints, hush-money, thrown to scorn,
His advocate circles, seeking untruth's retreat.
She stands stout, unraveled, in the courtroom's mirth,
Though questioned, her saga remains unbowed.
See, integrity cannot be bought with worth,
Even as the waning gale howls loud.
